general news.headline: I can charge more: Trump imposes 10% global tariff following Supreme Court rulingTrump announced a new 10% global tariff under Section 122 for 150 days, replacing duties struck down by the Supreme Court and signalling potential higher tariffs after fresh trade investigations.

Live: Will sign executive order to enact 10% global tariff, Trump says after Supreme Court defeatUS Supreme Court Tariff Ruling Live updates: The US Supreme Court on Friday struck down President Donald Trump's sweeping tariffs, delivering a major setback to one of his most aggressive economic measures. In a 6-3 ruling authored by Chief Justice John Roberts, the court upheld a lower court's decision that Trump exceeded his authority by invoking the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) of 1977 to levy broad import taxes. While the IEEPA allows a president to regulate financial transactions and oversee imports and exports during a national emergency, it does not explicitly authorise the imposition of tariffs. The court noted that although past presidents have used the law to impose sanctions, Trump was the first to apply it to tariffs. Reacting sharply, Trump called the ruling a "disgrace" and said he has a backup plan. The tariffs had targeted multiple countries, including a steep 50 per cent duty on India, intensifying global trade tensions. Stay tuned with IndiaToday.in for the latest updates.

How Iran-linked oil tanker seized by India went dark after entering Pak's sea zoneMT Asphalt Star, one of the three Iran-linked tankers seized near Mumbai, was detected operating suspiciously in Pakistan's Exclusive Economic Zone (EEZ). On January 28, the tanker went completely "dark" for about 11 hours, disabling its Automatic Identification System, Very High Frequency radio and onboard sensors, while concealing its identity.

US Supreme Court strikes down Trump's global tariffs 6-3, terms them illegalA Chief Justice John Roberts-led bench upheld a lower court ruling that Trump exceeded his authority by invoking the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA) to levy broad import taxes.

Trump tariffs ruled illegal: Will Indians get any refund or relief from US?The US Supreme Court has struck down President Donald Trump's tariffs on countries, including India, as illegal. This might open the door to billions of dollars in refunds, and might benefit US importers. There is no mechanism to compensate Indian exporters for the losses they suffered. However, they benefit as they regain a competitive edge in the US market.

Labelled a witch, woman with her 2-month-old son in arms, set on fire; both dieA 32-year-old woman, branded a witch, and her two-month-old baby, were set on fire by a mob in Jharkhand's Chaibasa earlier this week. Her husband, who was also attacked, somehow escaped and is currently hospitalised.

Why Bangladesh's secular Constitution starts with Bismillah, invokes Allah?Two events have brought Bangladesh's Constitution back into focus. The recent elections that made Tarique Rahman the Prime Minister, and the approval of the July Charter referendum, mandating fresh constitutional changes. It was Tarique's father, Ziaur Rahman, who altered the original secular framework and legalised religion-based politics. Now Bangladesh's Constitution straddles a duality.

AWS suffered outage because AI bot Kiro did some job, Amazon says user error behind itAmazon Web Services faced service disruption in December after its agentic AI bot, Kiro, was given the autonomy to fix a software issue. After Kiro did its job, the service suffered a glitch for hours.

Deport Indians: How H-1B debate is driving racism and hate speech in the USPolicy debates around the H-1B visa programme have shifted from concerns around jobs and wages to now inciting hate speech and racism against Indians and Indian-origin citizens in the US.
